definition: to abandon (cultivated fields)/no longer cultivated/to lie waste/wasted/to neglect (one's work or study)
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste

sentences.english: I wasted today, was precisely yesterday perishes person of the body implored.
sentences.chinese: 我荒废的今日，正是昨日殒身之人祈求的明日。

sentences.english: With desolation shall the earth be laid waste, and it shall be utterly spoiled: for the Lord hath spoken this word.
sentences.chinese: 大地必要完全荒废，惨遭浩劫，因为上主这样定了。

sentences.english: The house was unoccupied for several years and went to rack and ruin.
sentences.chinese: 这所房子因为好几年没有住人而荒废了。

sentences.english: In the northwest of China, long dry periods wasted the land.
sentences.chinese: 在中国西北，长期的干旱使土地荒废了。

sentences.english: I leave uncultivated today, was precisely yesterday perishes's tomorrow which person of the body implored.
sentences.chinese: 我荒废的今日，恰是昨日殒身之人祈求的明日。

sentences.english: Let's say you purchase a worn-out 100-acre farm in Michigan.
sentences.chinese: 比如说你在密歇根购买了一块100英亩荒废的农田。

sentences.english: I leave uncultivated today, was precisely yesterday perishes tomorrow which person of the body implored。
sentences.chinese: 我荒废的今日，正是昨日殒身之人祈求的明日。

sentences.english: However, after the death of Zhang Juzheng, the emperor began to neglect state affairs.
sentences.chinese: 然而，张居正死后，明神宗开始荒废朝政。

sentences.english: Today which I leave uncultivated, is precisely the next day begged by a person who perished yesterday .
sentences.chinese: 我荒废的今日，正是昨日殒身之人祈求的明日。

sentences.english: We have heard they are digging huge mass graves in the dump area.
sentences.chinese: 我们听说，当地人正在荒废地方挖掘一个巨大的坟墓。

sentences.english: This disinvestment laid waste to productivity.
sentences.chinese: 这些投资减缩荒废了生产力。

sentences.english: Regretful to say, he had dawdled away his golden time.
sentences.chinese: 说来遗憾，他荒废了宝贵的时光。

sentences.english: The demonic power that sparda once imprisoned…will be mine.
sentences.chinese: 而我将成为这个卷入了战乱的荒废大陆的最后统治者。

sentences.english: I leave uncultivated today, was precisely yesterday perishes tomorrow which person of the of the body implored.
sentences.chinese: 我荒废的今日，正式昨日殒身之人祈求的明日。

sentences.english: The prolonged war rusted his technique.
sentences.chinese: 长期的战争使他的技术荒废了。

sentences.english: Winterborne's contract was completed, and the plantations were deserted.
sentences.chinese: 维恩特波恩的合同完成后，那片林地变得荒废了。

definition: left to return to unchecked growth/overgrown/grown wild
to waste time on worthless activities
(literary) to slip/(of looks etc) to fade away/(of time) to slip away/to squander (time, opportunities)/to dillydally
to lie idle (of arable land)/fig. rusty because of lack of practice
to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
old and in a state of disrepair (idiom)/dilapidated
to engulf/to bury/to overlook/to stifle/to neglect/to fall into oblivion
